text:
<@U35F0P68G> 
```
        pickupAddress = in.readString();
        driverArrival = in.readString();
```
```
        dest.writeString(pickupAddress);
        dest.writeString(dropAddress);
        dest.writeString(driverArrival);
```
be careful, don’t write boilerplate yourself, generate it
<@U2M0WUZ7A> Thanks ..
also, Gson will expose all fields by default, `@Expose` is necessary only with `GsonBuilder.excludeFieldsWithoutExposeAnnotation()`
ok
:thinking_face:
1 min.

pickupAddress = in.readString();
        driverArrival = in.readString();
is correct ..
i am getting garbage values for   “dropLatitude"
and “ dropLongitude"
`dropAddress` must be read between `pickupAddress` and `driverArrival`
write a test on all of your fields
Ohh , i got what you r trying to say ...
<@U2M0WUZ7A> Thanks …It worked
<@U2M0WUZ7A> First time i write it rather using boilerplate ....!!!    Now i will use boilerplate . thanks for the help.

ok so I have a question
I’d like to profile our libs
the only way I can imagine doing that would be to create a simple sample application that includes libraries from us, and our competitors
is there a better way?
I’m interested in the usual metrics - memory and battery footprint, maybe also cpu but I don’t think that’ll be a huge factor (apart from battery impact)
the library (libraries) in question are pusher, pubnup, and maybe some others - need to do some research on that first.
suggestions welcome :slightly_smiling_face:
Show QA how to use the profiler
Ask QA to do it
You have now profiled your app
<@U08GFT5V5> Yes but if your companies are anything like our companies, dev and QA are the same person
<@U38TQ8KC4|pablo-casia> has joined the channel
<@U1LJG0Y03> I don't see the problem
It’s not a problem, it’s a feature
it’s not an app, it’s a lib <@U08GFT5V5>
<@U053PPGDC> Then build an app that uses the lib
yeah that’s the plan
no qa tho
:slightly_smiling_face:
Make sure you fail to follow all the best practices
if it's a best practice, don't do it
that will give you a baseline for mediocre devs out there

the guy was claimed there was multiple websockets being opened on reconnect

Guys who published on different China stores, how does it work? Can you download from one store and get an update from another? Or, do you sign with a different signature? What do you do, if they ask you for your private key (yes, that just happened:grimacing:)
They take the apk
and host it

>What do you do, if they ask you for your private key
you tell them in colorful language to stimulate themselves

> you tell them in colorful language to stimulate themselves
You may offer equipment to help with that if necessary
giving up your private keys means they want to put other things into your app and pass it off as you did it

> They take the apk 
> and host it

well, that's pretty much definition of any Store) I'm curios how it works with all those stores (up to 11) on the same device and stuff.
so im not kidding about telling them lots of language
<@U0QD0R2LS> if your APK is signed with your key it doesn’t matter where it comes from, an update is an update
any store could install it and the system will treat it the same
<@U0QD0R2LS> So here's the deal, anyone can distribute your APK, it keeps track of the version using the version code
The signing process is to let everyone know it's from you
and only you
on that note - how does amazon do it? Presume their apps are slightly modified (underground etc)
Even if they reverse engineer your app, they can't sign it with your key
how does amazon do what?
they offer apps sans in-app purchases
oh just with build flavors
their whole payment model is different afaik
so anyone asking for your private key is no doubt upto no good
presume you could also change the application id before publishing?
never give your key to anyone
<@U053PPGDC> your android manifest package id is what matters
two apks with different package ids are different applications
yeah
I’m gonna download an app from amazon now to see what happens

it quite likely has a different package id, if I was deploying to amazon and google play, I would ensure they are ‘different’ applications as it simplifies issue tracking for other variations like you say, IAP.

> if your APK is signed with your key it doesn’t matter where it comes from, an update is an update
yes, I totally understand that. I'm more interested in best practises from somebody who already tried it. For example, I can also see some benefits from having different signatures for different stores (yeah, basically, it's like having another app in your system). I'm not the first, there must be a common way of doing it
other people will likely have a different opinion on that and will use the same package for both versions but that’s a personal/business decision and one or the other may be more sensible for you
yeah
the play store will definitely just offer to open or uninstall an app if it finds it
<@U0QD0R2LS> for most people it's a transparent process.
You upload your app to google play
some chinese marketplace scrapes and hosts your apk
Some will try to reach out to offer stuff like translation services or access to the dashboard for your app so you can target China a little better
Amazon uses their SDK to track minutes of use and pay you IIRC, you unlock all the purchases in that flavor
Some will reverse engineer, translate and try to strip out Google ads if they are included and resign with their own key
^ true heroes
thank you all, the picture is more clear now!

RecyclerView stopped scrolling, it works if I removed the RecyclerView out of NestedScrollView->CoordinatorLayout.
the ViewPager is non scrollable, it means, user cannot page the ViewPager via swipe gesture
If I let go of CoordinatorLayout I will lose the Material toolbar. I just want the material toolbar (minus the animation or whatever it offers when its under CoordinatorLayout)
Thats why I am asking if I can use the widget Toolbar and smack it right into preferred ViewGroup

Like how notifications work, can’t the same be done for a view that is on top of the default lock screen?
Don't think that's possible
as far as I know
Any approach that is coming in your mind?

widget in iOS is still limited and located beside lock screen
not on the top of lock screen
